resources.string: Colocarem os logotipos das instituições envolvidas (podem vê-los no sobre….no fundo da página). Coloquem todos menos o último (o four eyes). Esse é para ser colocado no item a seguir

This work was partially funded by Project “TEC4Growth - Pervasive Intelligence, Enhancers and Proofs of Concept with Industrial Impact/NORTE-01-0145-FEDER-000020” which was financed by the NORTE 2020, under the PORTUGAL 2020, as well as by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) through the COMPETE 2020 Programme within project POCI-01-0145-FEDER-006961, and by National Funds through the FCT as part of project UID/EEA/50014/2013 and of the project UID/MAT/00212/2013.

A special thanks goes to the Portuguese Web Archive and to its team for creating an outstanding platform that aims to archive the Portuguese digital contents, thus providing not only the share of knowledge but also the emergence of new and innovative products.
For any inquires please contact Ricardo Campos at:
This project was developed by researchers affiliated to the Polytechnic Institute of Tomar, LIAAD INESC TEC, University of Porto, University of Beira Interior and University of Kyoto. \n

YAKE\'s app has been developed by Simão Samouco and João Campos under the supervision of Professor Ricardo Campos in the scope of the Final Project of the Computer Science degree of the Polytechnic Institute of Tomar, Portugal.
YAKE! is keyword extractor capable of automatically identifying the most relevant words in a document.
YAKE! is available at Google Play, online and on Github through which we make available a Python package.

As the amount of information generated increases, reading and summarizing large texts becomes a particularly difficult task. The need to automate this process requires the development of keyword extraction systems with the ability to automatically identify the most relevant words in a text. YAKE! appears in this context as an important contribution to a large number of tasks and a multiplicity of situations in which the extraction of relevant words plays a fundamental role.

YAKE! is an unsupervised automatic keyword extraction method (independent of dictionaries, thesauri or external data) which rests on text statistical features extracted from single documents to select the most important keywords of a text, thus making it easily applicable to documents of different sizes, domains, or languages.
Winner of the Best Short Paper at the 40th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR’18).
YAKE! is a research product. If you use it in a work that leads to a scientific publication, research project or product, please cite the following references:

Campos, R., Mangaravite, V., Pasquali, A., Jorge, A., Nunes, C., Jatowt, A. (2018). A Text Feature Based Automatic Keyword Extraction Method for Single Documents. In Gabriella Pasi et al. (Eds.), Lecture Notes in Computer Science - Advances in Information Retrieval - 40th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR\'18). Grenoble, France. March 26 – 29. Vol. 10772(2018), pp. 684 - 691.

Campos, R., Mangaravite, V., Pasquali, A., Jorge, A., Nunes, C., Jatowt, A. (2018). YAKE! Collection-independent Automatic Keyword Extractor. In Gabriella Pasi et al. (Eds.), Lecture Notes in Computer Science - Advances in Information Retrieval - 40th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR\'18). Grenoble, France. March 26 – 29. Vol. 10772(2018), pp. 806 - 810.
